author: Cory Evans
title: chevron-right
text: LITTLE ROCK (KATV) â€” The human remains found off [ Highway 7 North ](https://katv.com/news/local/suspected-human-remains-found-off-arkansas-highway-north-garland-county-sheriffs-office-gcso-criminal-investigations-division-cid-coroners-office-arkansas-state-crime-laboratory-lab-hot-springs-police-department-hspd-amir-ellis-identification-dna-testing#)in Garland County have been identified as the remains of 19-year-old Amir Ellis. Police confirmed that Ellis' remains were found in the woods off Highway 7 North near Blackmon Road. The Garland County Sheriff's Office originally was sent to the location on Dec. 18 as human remains were possibly found. Authorities responded, collected the remains, and sent them to the Arkansas State Crime Lab where they were identified as Ellis'. Since his disappearance, his mother, Jessica Ellis, had been searching for him and rallying volunteers to her cause. Ellis was originally reported missing to the Hot Springs Police Department back [on March 17.](https://katv.com/news/local/hot-springs-police-searching-for-missing-20-year-old-hspd-amir-isaiah-ellis-rocky-reef-circle-detective-branstentter-garland-county-arkansas-detective-branstentter-black-male-standing-5-feet-6-inches-weighing-160-pounds-with-black-hair-brown-eyes) In May, police confirmed that he had been kidnapped with [Three teens](https://katv.com/news/local/hot-springs-police-release-information-on-missing-20-year-old-amir-ellis-18-year-old-nathaniel-speed-18-year-old-alexia-chambers-three-suspect-juvenile-detective-brian-branstetter-hspd-fort-smith-police-department-gag-order-issued-garland-county-circuit) being arrested and charged.
